description: If Nova is configured to use syslog based logging, and there are multiple services running on a system, it becomes difficult to identify the service that emitted the log. This can be resolved if the log record also contains the name of the service/binary that generated the log. This will also be useful with an OpenStack system using a centralized syslog based logging mechanism.
title: Application/server name not available in service logs

comments.content: If Nova is configured to use syslog based logging, and there are multiple services running on a system, it becomes difficult to identify the service that emitted the log. This can be resolved if the log record also contains the name of the service/binary that generated the log. This will also be useful with an OpenStack system using a centralized syslog based logging mechanism.

commit 79e8a9a08daf563aa8a8d9280c9a6a27dcafc8f2
Author: Bogdan Dobrelya <email address hidden>
Date:   Thu Dec 19 13:46:55 2013 +0200

    Backport 'ident' from python 3.3 for Oslo's SysLogHandler
    
    To honor RFC5424 add use_syslog_rfc_format config option
    (default False, would be deprecated in J after existing
    syslog format deprecation) which adds APP-NAME to syslog message
    before MSG part to reflect application or service name.
    Usable only with use_syslog, otherwise ignored.
    
    During J, the default logging format for syslog should be changed
    to always provide APP-NAME, thus use_syslog_rfc_format could be
    deprecated in J as well.
    
    DocImpact
    Closes-bug: #904307
    
    Change-Id: I3815e6dc47e206e15f9da90ebbba5ca00c3ae641
    Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <email address hidden>
